Question Text: How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
Question Response: [ 1 ] - hyperlinked, at the bottom of the main page (Specht)

Question Text: How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
Question Response: [ 2 ] - visibly located on the main page, but no click required to accept, and no notice that privacy policy must be agreed upon (Nguyen v. Barnes and Noble)

Question Text: How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
Question Response: [ 3 ] - visible on the main page, with notice that user must agree to it, but no clicking requirement to agree (Rodman v. Safeway)

Question Text: How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
Question Response: [ 4 ] - visible on main page, with a “sign in” wrap that doesn’t unambiguously inform the user that clicking signifies assent to Privacy Policy. (Berkson v. Gogo)

Question Text: How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
Question Response: [ 5 ] - visible on main page, with a hyperlinked Privacy Policy and a requirements that the user unambiguously click on “I agree” to PP. (Fteja v. Facebook)

Question Text: How salient is the PP on the main webpage? [go to main page to check]
Question Response: [ 6 ] - visible on main page, with a Privacy Policy on a scroll down box  and a requirements that the user unambiguously click on “I agree” to PP.

Has California Privacy Rights Section that explains all rights afforded under the CCPA? (The right to request disclosure of  business’ data collection and sales practices , thecategories of personal information collected, the source of the information,  use of the information and, if the information was disclosed or sold to third parties, the categories of personal information disclosed or sold to third parties and the categories of third parties to whom such information was disclosed or sold; The right to request a copy of the specific personal information collected about them during the 12 months before their request (together with right #1, a “personal information request”); The right to have such information deleted (with exceptions); he right to request that their personal information not be sold to third parties, if applicable; and The right not to be discriminated against because they exercised any of the new rights.]
